definition: see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)

sentences.english: Therefore let's get prepared to embrace this irretrievable trend.
sentences.chinese: 因此让我们准备接受这势不可挡的趋势。

sentences.english: However, bad stress can be overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 然而，坏的压力则是势不可挡的。

sentences.english: Starts when is trickle the rivulet, afterward developed the irresistible mighty current.
sentences.chinese: 开始时是涓涓细流，后来发展成势不可挡的洪流。

sentences.english: Silicon Valley turned into an unstoppable force of innovation.
sentences.chinese: 至此，硅谷的创新潮流已经势不可挡。

sentences.english: Drake ignited his team and they embarked on a run of points accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 德拉克点燃了球员们的激情，球队开始势不可挡。

sentences.english: "I know. An overwhelming passion for it".
sentences.chinese: 我明白，寻求真理要有势不可挡的激情。

sentences.english: This new weapon, of which there would be many, would be unstoppable.
sentences.chinese: 这种新武器以后还会造更多，势不可挡。

sentences.english: This country's affection is overwhelming and furtive.
sentences.chinese: 这个国度的爱势不可挡却又遮遮掩掩。

sentences.english: They roar, they scream, then they laugh, and it's just been overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 他们狂吼尖叫，然后他们大笑，这将是势不可挡的。

sentences.english: Sometimes In our life, there are seasons when it seem he is being steamrolled by evil.
sentences.chinese: 有时在我们的生命中，我们会感到恶势力势不可挡。

sentences.english: The whale in the eyes of Zhuangzi is gallant, heroic and holy.
sentences.chinese: 庄子眼中的鲸是雄壮的，势不可挡甚至神圣的。

sentences.english: The dam collapsed, and the water plummeted irresistibly.
sentences.chinese: 大坝塌了，江水狂泻下来，势不可挡。

sentences.english: The rise of lap-dancing clubs has, at times, seemed unstoppable.
sentences.chinese: 脱衣舞俱乐部的兴起，有时，看起来势不可挡。

sentences.english: An irresistible power is diffusing the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气中弥漫着一股势不可挡的力量。

definition: impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
lit. a force to smash bamboo (idiom); fig. irresistible force
to be swept by the wind/to be blown about by the wind/to be routed (in battle etc)
